comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to The Rice belt journal. (Welsh, Calcasieu Parish, La.), 30 July 1915, image 6, col 4. chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn88064402/1915-07-30/ed-... Dr R. L. Wilson was the surgeon in charge of the federal quarantine station at Galveston. There was clearly a controversy between state and federal responsibility for inspecting incoming vessels.
